What do you think of the Homeland Defense Department?

I think the idea is great, but unfortunately, it won't work. There is no possible way to combine all of these departments and expect to be able to increase information about potential terrorist threats. All we are doing is throwing money at a problem without actually looking for a viable alternative.
I'd like it if Bush would fund it.

The DHS is a bunch of hogwash. It cannot be proven to be more efficent than when the different organizations were on their own, and it clearly violates (or gives the possibility of violation of) some of our Constitutional rights.

I know some of the concepts and techonolgy they are supporting is sound, but as to how they will be handeling the invasion of privacy issues and any violations of rights it will be interesting to see how that all comes to pass. I'd much rather not trade security for freedom.
We need a Mexican Border Defense Department if you ask me. That project would pay for itself by ridding the US of illegals who get welfare and send our tax payers money back to Mexico with them.
Militarize the border! Arrest Mexican soldiers assisting illegals in getting across the border!

Militarize the border! Arrest Mexican soldiers assisting illegals in getting across the border!

 
 There has to be no better way to spend our tax money than to lock down that border. Not only with that stop the Mexicans from crossing, it may even prevent drugs and terrorists from getting through it as well. This has to be the best idea that has yet to be implemented by our government. The only reason they don't do it is because whoever does it will lose the support of our nations largest minority, the latin americans.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Homeland Defense Department
